intro: Nigella deserti var. latilabris, commonly known as the desert sesame, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated seed pods that contain numerous small, black seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its botanical features make it a resilient and hardy species suitable for cultivation in similar climates.
